newsitem.title: USA: Florida Panthers chairman Huizenga not selling shares now.
newsitem.headline: Florida Panthers chairman Huizenga not selling shares now.

text.p: Florida Panthers Holdings Inc said Wednesday its chairman H. Wayne Huizenga has "no present intent to sell any of" the 5.02 million Class A shares he registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission on October 29.
The company clarified Huizenga's intentions regarding his plans for the 5,020,678 Class A common shares in a press release.
However in the SEC filing, the company had said the shares "may be offered for sale, hereby, from time to time, by H. Wayne Huizenga," the principal shareholder.
Florida Panthers is in the process of going public. It filed to offer up to 7.3 million Class A common shares on September 18.
The Fort Lauderdale, Fla.-based company owns and operates the Florida Panthers, a professional ice hockey team in the National Hockey League.
